column4: I have 3COM ISA Network card. My Ubuntu (Breezy Badger) doesn' t find it. HOW CAN I INSTALL IT? Is it needed a driver?
WHICH 3com card? And stop using caps for the love of all that's holy.
my result is - No such device or address
you're positive it's a II and not a III?
I think yes but what should I modprobe if it's a III?
Thank you ever so much. A few letters and ISA appears. I owe you a beer!
I think so because now it's working
heh, thought so. IIs are fairly rare these days.
It seems all ISA cards are rare used nowadays. At least I think so.
I still use a slew of IIIs
Minus for ISA is that it' s slow - only 10 Mbps
